projects.title: Data-Driven Precise and Personalized Medicine
projects.summary: Harnessing AI to tailor treatments to individuals and improve medical resource allocation at the community level.
projects.description: This initiative develops advanced predictive models that integrate data from electronic health records (EHRs), medical imaging, and wearable sensors to provide personalized treatment recommendations for individual patients. In parallel, it aims to optimize resource allocation and intervention strategies at the community and healthcare system levels. The methodological framework combines causal inference for understanding treatment effects, federated learning for privacy-preserving model training across institutions, and uncertainty-aware decision support systems to enhance the reliability and interpretability of clinical recommendations. Ultimately, this approach seeks to bridge precision medicine with public health optimization, ensuring that both individual and collective healthcare outcomes are improved.
projects.subtitle: Harnessing AI to tailor treatments to individuals and improve medical resource allocation at the community level.
outcomes: Open-source agent-based and machine learning models for simulating disease dynamics and treatment optimization
Peer-reviewed publications on AI-driven health behavior modeling, precision medicine, and socio-demographic analysis
Validated decision-support prototypes integrating causal inference and uncertainty-aware prediction for clinical and policy applications

timeline.title: Kickoff
timeline.text: Project launch with data collection pipelines established for EHR, imaging, and wearable sources, and alignment on research goals and governance protocols.

timeline.title: Reinforcement Learning Success
timeline.text: Successful deployment of reinforcement learning models in a real healthcare setting, demonstrating adaptive treatment recommendations under uncertainty.

timeline.title: Mathematical Advances
timeline.text: Development of improved mathematical formulations and interpretability methods for tree-based ensemble models, enhancing model stability and causal insight.

timeline.title: First Publications
timeline.text: Submission and acceptance of the first three peer-reviewed papers covering methodological innovations, simulation frameworks, and preliminary health applications.

timeline.title: Clinical Validation
timeline.text: Achievement of initial clinically validated results, confirming the model’s predictive and decision-support capabilities across multi-source healthcare data.

timeline.title: Team Expansion
timeline.text: Onboarding of new team members specializing in healthcare to extend the project’s scope and impact.

projects.title: Biomathematical Modeling of Cancer and Beyond
projects.summary: Developing bio-mathematical models for cancer spread and treatment, and for additional diseases, using ODEs, PDEs, and simulations.
projects.description: We develop multi-scale mathematical and computational models that integrate tumor growth dynamics, immune system interactions, and therapeutic intervention schedules. At the cellular and tissue levels, agent-based models (ABMs) capture spatial heterogeneity, stochastic behavior of individual cells, and local immune–tumor interactions. At the population or organ scale, continuum models—typically formulated as systems of partial differential equations (PDEs) or ordinary differential equations (ODEs)—describe macroscopic tumor expansion, immune infiltration, and drug diffusion. These scales are dynamically coupled to account for feedback between molecular, cellular, and systemic processes. Numerical solvers are implemented to simulate the coupled PDE–ODE systems, while agent-based simulations provide fine-grained insights into cellular mechanisms. Together, these computational frameworks enable optimization of treatment regimens, exploration of therapeutic synergies, and hypothesis testing for personalized and adaptive cancer therapies.
projects.subtitle: Developing bio-mathematical models for cancer spread and treatment, and for additional diseases, using ODEs, PDEs, and simulations.
outcomes: New multi-drug chemotherapy treatment protocol for metastatic prostate cancer
New multi-drug chemotherapy treatment protocol for lung cancer
PDE to ABS for cancer spread mapping algorithm

timeline.title: Kickoff
timeline.text: Starting to work on multi-drug cancer spread and treatment model.

timeline.title: Publishing 'Spatio-Temporal Model of Combining Chemotherapy with Senolytic Treatment in Lung Cancer'
timeline.text: First paper of the project published at Mathematical Biosciences

timeline.title: Publishing 'Spatio-temporal model of combining ADT and chemotherapy with senolytic treatment in metastatic prostate cancer'
timeline.text: Second paper of the project published at Journal of Theoretical Biology

projects.title: Moving Computational Economy To the AI Area
projects.summary: Using AI to uncover patterns, behaviors, and socio-economic impacts in the formal and informal economy.
projects.description: We fuse transaction traces, mobility proxies, and open data to infer hidden activity, model incentives, and evaluate policy. Techniques include graph learning, anomaly detection, and counterfactual simulation.
projects.subtitle: Using AI to uncover patterns, behaviors, and socio-economic impacts in the formal and informal economy.

projects.title: Developing the Next Step of Physics-Inspired Symbolic Regression
projects.summary: Advancing physics-informed symbolic regression for interpretable models discovered from data.
projects.description: We combine invariances, dimensional analysis, and sparse discovery to learn closed-form equations consistent with known physics. Benchmarks span fluid dynamics, control, and materials.
projects.subtitle: Advancing physics-informed symbolic regression for interpretable models discovered from data.

projects.title: A Biologically-Informed and Data-Driven Approach to Scientometrics
projects.summary: Leveraging biological principles and advanced analytics to evaluate scientific impact and trends.
projects.description: Drawing analogies from ecological systems (birth-death, migration, niche formation), we model research field dynamics and researcher trajectories; outputs inform funding and collaboration strategies.
projects.subtitle: Leveraging biological principles and advanced analytics to evaluate scientific impact and trends.

projects.title: Understanding Animals’ Behavior and Improving Their Wellness using AI
projects.summary: Analyzing behavioral and sensorial data to derive insights into animal health and welfare.
projects.description: We process video, accelerometer, and acoustic streams to detect pain, stress, and social patterns in domestic and farm animals. Results inform individualized care and welfare policy.
projects.subtitle: Analyzing behavioral and sensorial data to derive insights into animal health and welfare.

projects.title: Understanding Pandemic Spread and Optimizing Resource Allocation
projects.summary: Mathematical models and simulations to predict infectious disease spread and guide resource allocation.
projects.description: We extend compartmental models (age/space/variants), calibrate to surveillance data, and optimize NPIs and vaccine/antiviral distribution with fairness and logistics constraints.
projects.subtitle: Mathematical models and simulations to predict infectious disease spread and guide resource allocation.
